verses.verse: And there went <S%H3212><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Levi <S%H3878><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> to wife a daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Levi <S%H3878><s%>.

And the woman <S%H802><s%> conceived <S%H2029><s%>, and bare <S%H3205><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%>: and when she saw <S%H7200><s%> him that he was a goodly <S%H2896><s%> child, she hid <S%H6845><s%> him three <S%H7969><s%> months <S%H3391><s%>.

And when she could <S%H3201><s%> not longer <S%H5750><s%> hide <S%H6845><s%> him, she took <S%H3947><s%> for him an ark <S%H8392><s%> of bulrushes <S%H1573><s%>, and daubed <S%H2560><s%> it with slime <S%H2564><s%> and with pitch <S%H2203><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> therein; and she laid <S%H7760><s%> it in the flags <S%H5488><s%> by the river's <S%H2975><s%> brink <S%H8193><s%>.
And his sister <S%H269><s%> stood <S%H3320><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>, to wit <S%H3045><s%> what would be done <S%H6213><s%> to him.

And the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> to wash <S%H7364><s%> herself at the river <S%H2975><s%>; and her maidens <S%H5291><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> along by the river's <S%H2975><s%> side <S%H3027><s%>; and when she saw <S%H7200><s%> the ark <S%H8392><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the flags <S%H5488><s%>, she sent <S%H7971><s%> her maid <S%H519><s%> to fetch <S%H3947><s%> it.

And when she had opened <S%H6605><s%> it, she saw <S%H7200><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%>: and, behold, the babe <S%H5288><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%>. And she had compassion <S%H2550><s%> on him, and said <S%H559><s%>, This is one of the Hebrews' <S%H5680><s%> children <S%H3206><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> his sister <S%H269><s%> to Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%>, Shall I go <S%H3212><s%> and call <S%H7121><s%> to thee a nurse <S%H3243><s%> of the Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> women <S%H802><s%>, that she may nurse <S%H3243><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> for thee?

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, Go <S%H3212><s%>. And the maid <S%H5959><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> the child's <S%H3206><s%> mother <S%H517><s%>.

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto her, Take <S%H3212><s%> this child <S%H3206><s%> away <S%H3212><s%>, and nurse <S%H3243><s%> it for me, and I will give <S%H5414><s%> thee thy wages <S%H7939><s%>. And the woman <S%H802><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%>, and nursed <S%H5134><s%> it.

And the child <S%H3206><s%> grew <S%H1431><s%>, and she brought <S%H935><s%> him unto Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%>, and he became her son <S%H1121><s%>. And she called <S%H7121><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%>: and she said <S%H559><s%>, Because I drew <S%H4871><s%> him out of the water <S%H4325><s%>. Moses: that is, Drawn out

And it came to pass in those days <S%H3117><s%>, when Moses <S%H4872><s%> was grown <S%H1431><s%>, that he went out <S%H3318><s%> unto his brethren <S%H251><s%>, and looked <S%H7200><s%> on their burdens <S%H5450><s%>: and he spied <S%H7200><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> <S%H376><s%> smiting <S%H5221><s%> an Hebrew <S%H5680><s%>, one of his brethren <S%H251><s%>.

And he looked <S%H6437><s%> this way <S%H3541><s%> and that way <S%H3541><s%>, and when he saw <S%H7200><s%> that there was no man <S%H376><s%>, he slew <S%H5221><s%> the Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>, and hid <S%H2934><s%> him in the sand <S%H2344><s%>.

And when he went out <S%H3318><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, behold, two <S%H8147><s%> men <S%H582><s%> of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%> strove <S%H5327><s%> together: and he said <S%H559><s%> to him that did the wrong <S%H7563><s%>, Wherefore smitest <S%H5221><s%> thou thy fellow <S%H7453><s%>?

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Who made <S%H7760><s%> thee <S%H376><s%> a prince <S%H8269><s%> and a judge <S%H8199><s%> over us? intendest <S%H559><s%> thou to kill <S%H2026><s%> me, as thou killedst <S%H2026><s%> the Egyptian <S%H4713><s%>? And Moses <S%H4872><s%> feared <S%H3372><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Surely <S%H403><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%> is known <S%H3045><s%>. a prince: Heb. a man, a prince

Now when Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>, he sought <S%H1245><s%> to slay <S%H2026><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%>. But Moses <S%H4872><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> from the face <S%H6440><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and dwelt <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>: and he sat down <S%H3427><s%> by a well <S%H875><s%>.

Now the priest <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> had seven <S%H7651><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>: and they came <S%H935><s%> and drew <S%H1802><s%> water, and filled <S%H4390><s%> the troughs <S%H7298><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> their father's <S%H1><s%> flock <S%H6629><s%>. priest: or, prince

And the shepherds <S%H7462><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and drove them away <S%H1644><s%>: but Moses <S%H4872><s%> stood up <S%H6965><s%> and helped <S%H3467><s%> them, and watered <S%H8248><s%> their flock <S%H6629><s%>.

And when they came <S%H935><s%> to Reuel <S%H7467><s%> their father <S%H1><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%>, How <S%H4069><s%> is it that ye are come <S%H935><s%> so soon <S%H4116><s%> to day <S%H3117><s%>? Reuel: called also Jethro, or, Jether

And they said <S%H559><s%>, An Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> <S%H376><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the shepherds <S%H7462><s%>, and also drew <S%H1802><s%> water enough <S%H1802><s%> for us, and watered <S%H8248><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto his daughters <S%H1323><s%>, And where is he? why is it that ye have left <S%H5800><s%> the man <S%H376><s%>? call <S%H7121><s%> him, that he may eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>.
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> was content <S%H2974><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> with the man <S%H376><s%>: and he gave <S%H5414><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> Zipporah <S%H6855><s%> his daughter <S%H1323><s%>.

And she bare <S%H3205><s%> him a son <S%H1121><s%>, and he called <S%H7121><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> Gershom <S%H1647><s%>: for he said <S%H559><s%>, I have been a stranger <S%H1616><s%> in a strange <S%H5237><s%> land <S%H776><s%>. Gershom: that is, A stranger here

And it came to pass in process <S%H1992><s%> <S%H7227><s%> of time <S%H3117><s%>, that the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> died <S%H4191><s%>: and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> sighed <S%H584><s%> by reason of <S%H4480><s%> the bondage <S%H5656><s%>, and they cried <S%H2199><s%>, and their cry <S%H7775><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%> by reason of the bondage <S%H5656><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> their groaning <S%H5009><s%>, and God <S%H430><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> his covenant <S%H1285><s%> with Abraham <S%H85><s%>, with Isaac <S%H3327><s%>, and with Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.
And God <S%H430><s%> looked <S%H7200><s%> upon the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and God <S%H430><s%> had respect <S%H3045><s%> unto them. had: Heb. knew
